description:
When we get injured in some part of our body, it gets swollen(edema), this can also happen when we get sick, in this case, the lymphatic drainage massage can help to reduce this swelling.
This massage is done very carefully and gently on specific parts of the body, to help the fluid that is causing the swelling to move better through the body. The massage helps the body to heal itself more quickly, promoting a sense of well being.
text: Application of DLM - Manual Lymphatic DrainageIf you have ever experienced swollen limbs or discomfort due to lymphedema, lymphatic drainage massage may help you. This gentle massage technique is designed to stimulate the lymphatic system, which can help relieve the painful swelling caused by lymphedema. In this blog article on “Lymphatic drainage massage: What you need to know” is what you need to know about lymphatic drainage massage and how it can benefit your health. Lymphatic drainage massage, also known as manual lymphatic drainage is a specialised massage technique that targets the lymphatic system. The aim of lymph drainage massage is to improve the flow of lymph, which can become blocked due to surgery, injury or illness. Lymphatic drainage massage is commonly used to relieve swelling and discomfort caused by lymphedema, one of the conditions that can occur, such as after breast cancer surgery. title: Lymphatic Drainage Massage (LDM)

description: This gentle massage technique is designed to stimulate the lymphatic system, which can help relieve painful swelling (oedema) caused by lymphedema and other health conditions.
text: Application of DLM - Manual Lymphatic DrainageIf you have ever experienced swollen limbs or discomfort due to lymphedema, lymphatic drainage massage may help you. This gentle massage technique is designed to stimulate the lymphatic system, which can help relieve painful swelling caused by lymphedema. Below is what you need to know about lymphatic drainage massage and how it can benefit your health. I. Overview Lymphatic drainage massage, also known as manual lymphatic drainage, is a specialized massage technique that targets the lymphatic system. The goal of lymph drainage massage is to improve the flow of lymph, which may become obstructed due to surgery, injury, or illness. In particular, lymphatic drainage massage is commonly used to relieve swelling and discomfort caused by lymphedema, one of the conditions that can occur, such as after breast cancer surgery. II. Details of the procedure The lymphatic drainage massage technique involves a two-step process which are as follows: cleansing reabsorption. During the cleansing phase, the therapist gently massages the lymph nodes to encourage the lymph fluid to move towards the affected area. In the reabsorption phase, the therapist uses light pressure to help the lymphatic system reabsorb the fluid. Mechanical lymphatic drainage massage devices such as compression pumps can also be used as an alternative to traditional massage techniques, however, systolic and diastolic blood pressure values should be noted as well as heart and respiratory rate, a cardiovascular risk assessment should also be done before using the mechanical pumping system. III. Risks/Benefits Lymphatic drainage massage is generally considered safe and can provide numerous benefits for those suffering from lymphedema. With the application of lymphatic drainage massage, there are benefits in the following pathologies: Lymphedema Fibromyalgia Rheumatoid Arthritis Chronic fatigue syndrome Migraines It is important to make it clear that, despite being a gentle mobilisation technique, there are still some risks associated with lymphatic drainage massage. In some cases, massage can worsen the symptoms of lymphedema, so it may be recommended that you consult the professional who will be applying the manual lymphatic drainage massage before undergoing this treatment. Lymphatic drainage massage should also be avoided if you have certain health conditions such as active infections, blood clots, heart condition or kidney failure. IV. Recovery and Outlook After lymphatic drainage massage, you may experience immediate effects such as reduced swelling and pain. Long-term effects may include improved immune function and decreased risk of infection. Your massage therapist may also suggest lymphatic drainage massage techniques that you can apply to yourself in the comfort of your home. Knowing that the human body functions as an organism with twelve interconnected systems, it is important to monitor your symptoms and inform your lymphatic drainage massage therapist, about its effectiveness in managing your health condition. If you experience any side effects, such as fever or resurgence of edema with greater intensity it is important to seek medical attention. V. Recent literature and medical advice A quick PubMed search on lymphatic drainage massage methods (Vodder, LeDuc), reveals that this therapeutic approach is undoubtedly an excellent way for those suffering from disorders of the lymphatic and cardiovascular system, such as oedema and lymphedema. According to the European Portal on Rare Diseases and Orphan Drugs (Orphanet), the prevalence of this disease is 1-5/10 000, making primary lymphoedema one of the rare diseases. VI. Conclusion A person can use lymphatic drainage massage techniques to help reduce swelling and improve circulation. An effectively functioning lymphatic system is essential for overall health. It is important to know that with proper care and treatment, it is possible to manage symptoms and improve quality of life. Learn more about how to book this Lymphatic Manual Drainage online
title: Lymphatic Drainage Massage: What You Need to Know

description: Understanding the Causes and Seeking Effective Treatment.
text: Improving your health and quality of life today Do you know that in Portugal at least 1 in 3 people (37%) live with chronic pain? Chronic pain is a health problem, worldwide, that affects millions of people and can have a major impact on their quality of life. Living with chronic pain can be challenging as it affects your daily life and social roles. In the biopsychosocial view, pain management, addresses the psychological and social consequences that chronic pain can have, as well as the importance of considering biological, psychological and social factors in the assessment and treatment of chronic pain. It is well known that chronic pain can affect quality of life, relationships and the ability to perform daily activities. To better understand the causes of pain it is important to understand the difference between primary and secondary chronic pain for better pain management. Primary chronic pain is pain that is not caused by any other health condition, but is a condition in itself. For example, chronic headache is a primary pain. Secondary chronic pain is that which is caused by an underlying health condition, such as arthritis or nerve damage. Pain Classification according to IASP 2021It is important to note that some chronic pain can be a sign of a more serious health problem and therefore you should be alert to some of the symptoms such as fever, unexplained weight loss, muscle weakness, changes in sensitivity or progressive and persistent pain. If you experience any of these symptoms you should seek medical attention immediately. Along with other professionals, such as musculoskeletal therapists (massage therapists, osteopaths, physiotherapists), doctors and pharmacists, psychology also has a role in the treatment of chronic pain, observing case by case and intervening to help the brain communicate in a healthier way with the body, thus reorganising the patient’s brain function. To improve their health, it is essential to change habits and patterns of behaviour. The individual with chronic pain is an integral part of the process, so it is important that there is communication, with information and guidance, to help them understand the importance of their active participation in the treatment. Their collaboration is fundamental for the success of the treatment, since they are the ones who must perform the tasks and make the changes in their daily lives that contribute to improving their state of health. Massage has been by choice, a treatment option for chronic pain, in particular for secondary chronic pain. Based on scientific evidence, massage is indicated by medicine, as a way to relieve pain in most cases. For example, a 2011 study published in the journal Annals of Internal Medicine1, another study shows, that after applying massage there is a significant reduction of pain2. For those who suffer on a daily basis with chronic pain, the use of musculoskeletal manual therapy, by a qualified professional is a condition for the relief of pain, in order to restore the functionality of the affected limb or the body in general. It is always important to mention, that depending on the pain mechanism, there may be a need for a more comprehensive approach, including other health care professionals, with the purpose of supporting chronic pain management. Contact TrataMentœs today to schedule your first appointment and start experiencing the many benefits of regular massage. Cherkin, D. C., Sherman, K. J., Kahn, J., Wellman, R., Cook, A. J., Johnson, E., Erro, J., Delaney, K., & Deyo, R. A. (2011). A comparison of the effects of 2 types of massage and usual care on chronic low back pain. Annals of Internal Medicine, 155(1), 1. https://doi.org/10.7326/0003-4819-155-1-201107050-00002 ↩︎ Adams, R., White, B., & Beckett, C. (2010). The effects of massage therapy on pain management in the acute care setting. International journal of therapeutic massage & bodywork, 3(1), 4–11. https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3091428/pdf/ijtmb-3-1-4.pdf ↩︎
title: Living with Chronic Pain in Portugal

description: Improve your health and quality of life today.
text: Improving your health and quality of life today As we age, our bodies tend to slow down physiological processes, and with the challenges of modern life, the body accumulates more and more stress, in the majority of the population, leading to chronic pain and other health problems. Massage therapy produces a significant reduction in the following symptoms: pain, fatigue, anxiety, muscle discomfort, nervousness, stress.1 It promotes improved blood and lymphatic circulation, which can lead to a reduction in overall inflammation the body123. Massage therapy improves relaxation, circulation4, energy levels by promoting tranquility and emotional well-being in patients1, thus contributing to a healthier and more active lifestyle. The creation of the TrataMentœs company arose with the objective of preserving, restoring and promoting health as a whole. The massage and wellness technician is specialized in the diagnosis, management, treatment and prevention of musculoskeletal and other related disorders, with techniques based on scientific evidence. Today, science explains the effects of massage on the representation of pain in specific areas, leading to the relief of body tension by promoting relaxation throughout the body. More recent studies show that sleep plays an increasingly important role and point to the benefits of manual therapy in reducing stress, improving sleep5, increasing energy, and a more positive outlook on life.3 Have you thought about giving your body the attention it deserves? text: We respect the privacy of our website visitors and are committed to protecting their personal information. This privacy policy outlines the types of personal information that we collect, how we use it, and the steps that we take to ensure that it remains secure. Information that we collect When you visit our website, we may collect certain types of information from you, including: Your name and contact information, such as your name, email address and phone number Information about your browsing behavior on our website, such as the pages that you visit and the links that you click on Demographic information, such as your age and gender How we use your information We use the information that we collect from you in a number of ways, including: To respond to your inquiries and provide you with information about our products and services To improve our website and the user experience for our visitors To send you marketing communications, such as newsletters and promotional offers To comply with legal and regulatory requirements Sharing your information We may share your personal information with third parties in certain circumstances, such as: To our service providers who help us operate our website and provide our services to you To law enforcement agencies, regulatory authorities, or other third parties if we believe that disclosure is necessary to comply with a legal obligation or to protect our rights or the rights of others In connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of our business or assets Cookies and similar technologies Our website may use cookies and other similar technologies to collect information about your browsing behavior and preferences. These technologies allow us to provide you with a more personalized experience on our website. Data retention and security We will retain your personal information for as long as necessary to fulfill the purposes for which it was collected, or as required by law. We take appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure that your personal information is secure and protected from unauthorized access or disclosure. Your rights You have the right to: Request access to the personal information that we hold about you Request that we correct any inaccuracies in your personal information Request that we delete your personal information, subject to certain exceptions Object to the processing of your personal information for marketing purposes Contact us If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy policy, or if you would like to exercise your rights in relation to your personal information, please contact us via contact form.
